ai-mn112:3.1_0: That monk’s speech, monks, is not to be rejoiced over, not to be scorned at.
ai-mn112:3.3_0: ‘Reverends, these four kinds of expression rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-mn112:3.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?

ai-mn112:3.6_0: These are the four kinds of expression rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-mn112:3.7_0: How does the venerable know and see regarding these four kinds of expression so that your mind is freed from defilements by not grasping?’
ai-mn112:4.1_0: For a mendicant with defilements ended—who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment—it is in line with the teaching to answer:
ai-mn112:4.2_0: ‘Reverends, I live without attraction or repulsion for what is seen; independent, untied, liberated, detached, my mind free of limits.
ai-mn112:4.5_0: or known; independent, untied, liberated, detached, my mind free of limits.
ai-mn112:4.6_0: That is how I know and see regarding these four kinds of expression so that my mind is freed from defilements by not grasping.’
ai-mn112:5.1_0: Saying ‘Good!’ you should applaud and cheer that mendicant’s statement,
ai-mn112:5.3_0: ‘Reverend, these five grasping aggregates have been rightly explained by the Buddha.

ai-mn112:5.6_0: These are the five grasping aggregates that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-mn112:5.7_0: How does the venerable know and see regarding these five grasping aggregates so that your mind is freed from defilements by not grasping?’
ai-mn112:6.1_0: For a mendicant with defilements ended—who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment—it is in line with the teaching to answer:
ai-mn112:6.2_0: ‘Reverends, knowing that form is powerless, fading, and unreliable, I understand that my mind is freed through the ending, fading away, cessation, giving away, and letting go of attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendency for form.
ai-mn112:6.6_0: consciousness is powerless, fading, and unreliable, I understand that my mind is freed through the ending, fading away, cessation, giving away, and letting go of attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendency for consciousness.
ai-mn112:6.7_0: That is how I know and see regarding these five grasping aggregates so that my mind is freed from defilements by not grasping.’
ai-mn112:7.1_0: Saying ‘Good!’ you should applaud and cheer that mendicant’s statement,
ai-mn112:7.3_0: ‘Reverend, these six elements have been rightly explained by the Buddha.

ai-mn112:8.1_0: For a mendicant with defilements ended—who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment—it is in line with the teaching to answer:
ai-mn112:8.2_0: ‘Reverends, I’ve not taken the earth element as self, nor is there a self based on the earth element.
ai-mn112:8.3_0: And I understand that my mind is freed through the ending, fading away, cessation, giving away, and letting go of attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendency based on the earth element.
ai-mn112:8.9_0: And I understand that my mind is freed through the ending of attraction based on the consciousness element.
ai-mn112:8.10_0: That is how I know and see regarding these six elements so that my mind is freed from defilements by not grasping.’
ai-mn112:9.1_0: Saying ‘Good!’ you should applaud and cheer that mendicant’s statement,

ai-mn112:10.2_0: ‘I understand that my mind is freed through the ending, fading away, cessation, giving away, and letting go of desire and greed and relishing and craving; attraction, grasping, mental fixation, insistence, and underlying tendency for the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and things knowable by eye consciousness.
ai-mn112:10.3_0: I understand that my mind is freed through the ending of desire for the ear ...

ai-mn112:11.3_0: ‘Sir, how does the venerable know and see so that he has eradicated ego, possessiveness, and underlying tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli?’
ai-mn112:12.1_0: For a mendicant with defilements ended—who has completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and is rightly freed through enlightenment—it is in line with the teaching to answer:
ai-mn112:12.2_0: ‘Formerly, reverends, when I was still a layperson, I was ignorant.
ai-mn112:12.3_0: Then the Realized One or one of his disciples taught me the Dhamma.
ai-mn112:12.4_0: I gained faith in the Realized One,
ai-mn112:12.6_0: “Living in a house is cramped and dirty, but the life of one gone forth is wide open.
ai-mn112:12.7_0: It’s not easy for someone living at home to lead the spiritual life utterly full and pure, like a polished shell.
ai-mn112:12.8_0: Why don’t I cut off my hair and beard, dress in ocher robes, and go forth from lay life to homelessness?”
ai-mn112:13.1_0: After some time I gave up a large or small fortune, and a large or small family circle. I shaved off hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and went forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-mn112:13.2_0: Once I had gone forth, I took up the training and livelihood of the mendicants. I gave up killing living creatures, renouncing the rod and the sword. I was scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.
ai-mn112:13.3_0: I gave up stealing. I took only what’s given, and expected only what’s given. I kept myself clean by not thieving.
ai-mn112:13.4_0: I gave up unchastity. I became celibate, set apart, avoiding the common practice of sex.
ai-mn112:13.5_0: I gave up lying. I spoke the truth and stuck to the truth. I was honest and trustworthy, not tricking the world with my words.
ai-mn112:13.6_1: He doesn’t repeat in one place what he heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, he reconciles those who are divided, supporting unity, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.
ai-mn112:13.7_1: They speak in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.
ai-mn112:13.8_1: Their words were timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training. They said things at the right time which are valuable, reasonable, succinct, and beneficial.
ai-mn112:14.1_0: I avoided injuring plants and seeds. I ate in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night and food at the wrong time.
ai-mn112:14.2_0: I avoided dancing, singing, music, and seeing shows.
ai-mn112:14.3_0: I avoided beautifying and adorning myself with garlands, perfumes, and makeup.
ai-mn112:14.4_0: I avoided high and luxurious beds.
ai-mn112:14.5_0: I avoided receiving gold and money,
ai-mn112:14.14_0: I avoided running errands and messages;
ai-mn112:14.18_0: mutilation, murder, abduction, banditry, plunder, and violence.
ai-mn112:14.19_0: It was content with robes to look after the body and alms-food to look after the belly.
ai-mn112:14.19_1: Wherever they go, I set out taking only these things.
ai-mn112:14.20_0: Like a bird: wherever it flies, wings are its only burden.
ai-mn112:14.21_1: became content with robes to look after the body and alms-food to look after the belly.
ai-mn112:14.21_2: Wherever they go, I set out taking only these things.
ai-mn112:14.22_0: When I had this entire spectrum of noble ethics, I experienced a blameless happiness inside myself.
ai-mn112:15.1_0: When I saw a sight with my eyes, I didn’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-mn112:15.2_0: If the faculty of sight were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming.
ai-mn112:15.2_1: For this reason, practice restraint, protect the faculty of sight, and achieve its restraint.
ai-mn112:15.3_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...

ai-mn112:15.7_0: When I knew a thought with my mind, I didn’t get caught up in the features and details.
ai-mn112:15.8_0: If the faculty of mind were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming.
ai-mn112:15.8_1: protect the faculty of mind, and achieve its restraint.
ai-mn112:15.9_0: When I had this noble sense restraint, I experienced an unsullied bliss inside myself.
ai-mn112:16.1_0: I acted with situational awareness when going out and coming back; when looking ahead and aside; when bending and extending the limbs; when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes; when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; when urinating and defecating; when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent.
ai-mn112:16.2_0: When they have this noble spectrum of ethics, this noble sense restraint, and this noble mindfulness and situational awareness,
ai-mn112:16.3_0: I frequented a secluded lodging—a wilderness, the root of a tree, a hill, a ravine, a mountain cave, a charnel ground, a forest, the open air, a heap of straw.
ai-mn112:16.4_0: After the meal, I returned from alms-round, sat down cross-legged with my body straight, and established mindfulness right there.
ai-mn112:17.1_0: Giving up desire for the world, I meditated with a heart rid of desire, cleansing the mind of desire.
ai-mn112:17.2_0: Giving up ill will and malevolence, I meditated with a mind rid of ill will, full of compassion for all living beings, cleansing the mind of ill will.
ai-mn112:17.3_0: Giving up dullness and drowsiness, I meditated with a mind rid of dullness and drowsiness, perceiving light, mindful and aware, cleansing the mind of dullness and drowsiness.
ai-mn112:17.4_0: Giving up restlessness and remorse, I meditated without restlessness, my mind peaceful inside, cleansing the mind of restlessness and remorse.
ai-mn112:17.5_0: Giving up doubt, I meditated having gone beyond doubt, not undecided about skillful qualities, cleansing the mind of doubt.
ai-mn112:18.1_0: They give up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.
ai-mn112:18.2_0: Then, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, I entered and remained in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-mn112:19.1_0: When my mind had become immersed in samādhi like this—purified, bright, flawless, rid of corruptions, pliable, workable, steady, and imperturbable—I extended it toward knowledge of the ending of defilements.
ai-mn112:19.2_0: I truly understood: “This is suffering” ... “This is the origin of suffering” ... “This is the cessation of suffering” ... “This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering”.
ai-mn112:19.3_0: I truly understood: “These are defilements”... “This is the origin of defilements” ... “This is the cessation of defilements” ... “This is the practice that leads to the cessation of defilements”.
ai-mn112:20.1_0: Knowing and seeing like this, my mind was freed from the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-mn112:20.2_0: When it was freed, I knew it was freed.
ai-mn112:20.3_0: I understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
ai-mn112:20.4_0: That’s how to know and see so that there’s ego, possessiveness, and underlying tendency to conceit for this conscious body and all external stimuli.’
